title: ABA League JTD
text:
Adriatic Basketball Association – ABA League, <a href="General%20partnership">G.P.</a>, commonly referred to as the ABA League JTD, is a <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>n <a href="company">company</a> based in <a href="Zagreb">Zagreb</a>. It is the general partnership for organizing <a href="Sports%20competition">sports competitions</a>. The company has been running the <a href="ABA%20League">Adriatic League</a> since the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20ABA%20League">2015–16 season</a>.
The company runs and operates the three regional-wide men's <a href="Professional%20basketball">professional</a> <a href="sports%20club">club</a> <a href="basketball">basketball</a> competitions in <a href="South-Eastern%20Europe">South-Eastern Europe</a>, the <a href="European%20professional%20club%20basketball%20system">first-tier</a> <a href="ABA%20League%20First%20Division">ABA League First Division</a>, the <a href="European%20professional%20club%20basketball%20system">second-tier</a> <a href="ABA%20League%20Second%20Division">ABA League Second Division</a>, and the <a href="ABA%20League%20Supercup">ABA League Supercup</a> tournament.
Founders and shareholders.
The founders, as well as the <a href="Shareholder">shareholders</a> between 2015 and 2020, of the company were 12 <a href="basketball">basketball</a> <a href="Club%20%28sport%29">clubs</a>, as follows <a href="KK%20Budu%C4%87nost">KK Budućnost</a> (<a href="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>), <a href="KK%20Cedevita">KK Cedevita</a> (<a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>), <a href="KK%20Cibona">KK Cibona</a> (Croatia), <a href="KK%20Crvena%20zvezda">KK Crvena zvezda</a> (<a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>), <a href="KK%20Igokea">KK Igokea</a> (<a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>), <a href="KK%20Krka">KK Krka Telekom Novo Mesto</a> (<a href="Slovenia">Slovenia</a>), <a href="KK%20Mega%20Basket">KK Mega Vizura</a> (Serbia), <a href="KK%20Metalac%20Valjevo">KK Metalac Valjevo</a> (Serbia), <a href="KK%20MZT%20Skopje">KK MZT Skopje Aerodrom AD Skopje</a> (<a href="North%20Macedonia">North Macedonia</a>), <a href="KK%20Olimpija">KK Olimpija Ljubljana</a> (Slovenia), <a href="KK%20Partizan">KK Partizan</a> (Serbia), and <a href="KK%20Zadar">KK Zadar</a> (Croatia).
In the late 2020, the shares owned by Cedevita, Metalac, MZT Skopje Aerodrom and Olimpija Ljubljana were transferred to <a href="KK%20Cedevita%20Olimpija">KK Cedevita Olimpija</a> (Slovenia), <a href="KK%20Koper%20Primorska">KK Koper Primorska</a> (Slovenia), <a href="KK%20Mornar%20Bar">KK Mornar Bar</a> (Montenegro), and <a href="KK%20FMP">KK FMP</a> (Serbia).
